main event: An unidentified flying object was observed near Point Lookout, Maryland on 11th October 1955 for 2.5 hours after sunset. The object emitted alternating reddish and white sparks, disappeared and reappeared, and produced a deep roaring sound not typical of any known aircraft or object.
interesting points: The object was described as spherical, turning red after sunset, emitting sparks, and producing a deep roaring sound
The observation lasted for 2.5 hours and the object circled the sky directly overhead, silently and at an unknown altitude
Weather conditions at the time were very good with high ceiling, clear visibility, and no cloud cover
The observers were Mr. __________ and another individual from Hyattsville and West Hyattsville, Maryland
One officer was convinced it was a genuine unidentified object, while another was curious but neither convinced nor unconvinced
sighted object: Unidentified spherical object emitting sparks and producing a deep roaring sound
witnesses: Civilian and U.S. Air Force officers
